    level="1"
    right="Item 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Arboreal's Revenge](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1174)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Cursed" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=274" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 160</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 2 hands

**Bulk** 2
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This walnut and brass _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [blunderbuss](/Weapons.aspx?ID=196)_ has a natural look, with wood worn smooth by time, but left knotted and gnarled. The handgrip beneath the flared muzzle is a well-positioned bulging tree knot, and the long stock looks as if it was grown to fit you. On closer examination, the whorls and rings in the wood resemble eyes.

 _Arboreal's revenge_ is a haunted firearm constructed with wood hewn from a living [arboreal](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=8), slaying the arboreal and trapping its spirit in the firearm. Perhaps a patient wielder could one day put the arboreal's spirit to rest, or at least come to terms with it, abating the drawbacks of the weapon while keeping its advantages.

 When you first fire _arboreal's revenge_, the blunderbuss fuses with you, after which it's almost impossible to remove it from your possession with a [_remove curse_](/Spells.aspx?ID=250) or similar effect, like many cursed items. You gain weakness 5 to [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) and the flat check for you to recover from [persistent fire damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) increases from 15 to 17, or from 10 to 12 if you receive appropriate help. 

Whenever you wield _arboreal's revenge_, the arboreal spirit bound to the blunderbuss attempts to overtake you. The wood handgrip sprouts roots which grow around your hand, binding both of your hands to the firearm. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to your Reflex DC when defending against checks to [Disarm](/Actions.aspx?ID=41) you. However, you can't Release your grip on the blunderbuss until you forcibly tear off the roots, though they do allow you to move your hands enough (and only enough) to reload and fire the blunderbuss. Tearing off the roots takes 1 minute.

 The arboreal haunting the firearm can use the following two effects whenever it wants, often using them at random. You can coax it into performing them each intentionally once per day, with the following activations.
